issue.description: their DIS example has ISO/DIS #####-## ICS ##.###.##; ##.###.## It does not have the edition. I assume that the edition is required, so I have changed it to: ISO/DIS 10303-239:2004(E) First edition 2004 ICS ##.###.##; ##.###.##

comment.description:
No we don't put the edition on the DIS. What we do do, if the DIS is a revision of another standard, is to put under the title [Revision of Xxxxx edition (ISO ####:####)]
See the attached DIS for an example. This is of course not in HTML but is sufficient to give you the general idea. Off hand I don't recall a case of an HTML DIS which is a revision but if you are desperate I can always dig so let me know.
